column4: Where's the best place to go for troubleshooting Nvidia driver installation?
make sure the linux-restricted-modules package is for the kernel you are booted to
if your using the 9xxx series driver make sure you get the l-r-m package for them
make sure it matches the kernel you are booted to
please paste the output of the following commands in pastebin. apt-cache policy nvidia-glx  uname -r
did you change the xorg.conf file to use the nvidia drivers?
im betting its looking at the l-r-m package for 2.6.17.5-11
but wouldn't that just show the last x start (after I changed nvidia to nv)?
you need to remove the linux-restricted-modules packages you have and install the one for the kernel. from the errors its not reading the right one.
